definition: to meet by accident
to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: Not now, not since I bumped into him again.
sentences.chinese: 现在没有，从我再次撞见他以来都没有。

sentences.english: Just left, Lin Ying baby bump into the village.
sentences.chinese: 刚刚离开时，林婴婴就撞见了腾村。

sentences.english: We bumped into each other when we were shopping in the Trust Mart.
sentences.chinese: 我们俩都在好又多购物时，撞见了彼此。

sentences.english: I bumped into my ex-boyfriend the other day in the street.
sentences.chinese: 我前几天在街上撞见了我的前男友。

sentences.english: It was embarrassing for him to bump into one of his ex- girlfriends last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨天晚上撞见其中一个前女友真是让他尴尬。

sentences.english: Just a little, but caught wind says to want to forget himself, and cause contacts.
sentences.chinese: 只是阿一却撞见小风说要遗忘本人，和大业交往。

sentences.english: I ran into her last year on Madison Avenue in midtown.
sentences.chinese: 我去年还在市中心的麦迪逊大道上撞见她。

sentences.english: I go home, and when I get there, I find my wife in bed with the gardener.
sentences.chinese: 回到家后，撞见我妻子和园丁在床上鬼混。

sentences.english: On my way to office, I came across something interesting.
sentences.chinese: 我在上班的路上撞见了一件有趣的事。

sentences.english: Junjie caught horse standing in line to buy tickets in the supermarket of the PP.
sentences.chinese: 俊杰在超市里撞见在排队买马票的PP。

sentences.english: Shu ping to show jade to gather the absorbtion bump into ancient books yu mei with walking.
sentences.chinese: 淑萍跟秀玉采海菜时撞见古韵书带毓梅散步。

sentences.english: Is you covertly goes to and her appointment feared the wife bumps into woman.
sentences.chinese: 就是你偷偷摸摸地去和她约会又怕妻子撞见的女人。

sentences.english: The policeman caught Soapy stealing the money from the old lady.
sentences.chinese: 那个警察撞见了苏比在偷那位老太太的钱。

sentences.english: His father caught him filching apples.
He was found desperately trying to untangle several reels of film.
sentences.chinese: 他被撞见拼命想要解开几盘缠在一起的胶卷。

sentences.english: If we run into her at the mall, I don't even want to talk to her.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们在商场里撞见，我可不愿意搭理她。

definition: to run into/to meet (unexpectedly)/to bump into
just by chance/to happen to (just at the right time)/opportune
by chance/by coincidence/to happen to
by chance/by coincidence/by good luck
a chance encounter/to meet accidentally
lovers' rendezvous/tryst
to peep/to peek/to steal a glance
to carry on a clandestine love affair
fortunately/unexpectedly/by coincidence
to run into/to come upon/to meet
by coincidence/it so happened that/fortunately/against expectation
too bad/unfortunately/as luck would have it
accidentally/unintentionally/unexpectedly
to tug at/to pull at sb aggressively/to take sb's hand or arm in a too familiar way/(derog.) to hobnob/to consort
to take liberties with a woman/to dally/to assail a woman with obscenities
to peep/to peek/to act as voyeur
